thread.title: PRINCIPAL, HUBBY IN FORGE RAP
thread.title_full: PRINCIPAL, HUBBY IN FORGE RAP - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: PRINCIPAL, HUBBY IN FORGE RAP
text: AN ASSISTANT PRINCIPAL at a Queens school and her ex-con husband were charged yesterday with money counterfeiting, police said. Mia Peebles-Anderson, an administrator at Public School 147 in Cambria Heights, looked the other way as her husband, Matthew Anderson, pumped out phony $10 bills in the couple's Rosedale home, authorities said. "He was on parole from federal prison," a source said. "He was already in prison for counterfeiting money." Both Peebles-Anderson, 37, and her husband were charged with forgery and possession of a forged instrument. Matthew Anderson, 38, was also charged with possession of a manufacturing device and intent to use it.
